One of the features that separates Mozart's Friend from other apps is the attention to the rules and nomenclature of music theory, and all notes and intervals are labeled using standard music notation shorthand. 

An interval represents the musical relationship between two pitches: 

 [interval quality][interval number] 

For example "M3" means the Major 3rd, while "d5" means the diminished 5th, and so on. 

Interval quality: 

 P = Perfect 
 M = Major 
 m = minor 
 A = Augmented 
 d = diminished 

So for example, if we look up our trusty E Major chord under the Chords menu, we will see that the chord is composed of the root, E (also known as "P1" or "Perfect 1st" interval), the Major 3rd, G# ("M3"), and the Perfect 5th, B ("P5"). 

Note also that the note naming strictly adheres to the key signature, again following the rules of music theory. For example, the minor 3rd ("m3") of the G minor scale is Bb, not A#. While A# and Bb are the same pitch, they hold different meanings which are tied to the key signature. 

You can customize the tuning of your stringed instruments absolutely any way you wish under the Settings menu while maintaining full confidence that all rules follow professional standard. Double sharps and flats are also observed to maintain correctness. 

Some users may be accustomed to familiar chord diagrams, such as the faithful "320033" shape G Major chord. However note that this version of the G Major chord is only usable in standard tuning and in the third fret position. 

For this reason, the Chord function was designed to display the map of notes available to choose from and allow the user to construct their own chord based on their own tunings, desired voicing and target area of the fretboard. 

The Hear It! feature is a one-touch audio demonstration of the current selection, perfect for quick interactive feedback to learn the sound or just to check if you've got the right chord! 

Furthermore, note that Hear It! automatically tracks which notes are selected, so you can hear, say, what a minor 7th chord sounds like with and without the minor 3rd. Or what the Dorian scale sounds like with and without the minor 2nd. The choice of what you want to audition is completely up to you!

Mozart's Friend includes the first metronome with fully programmable tones and intervallic beats, allowing you to quickly outline a chord to play along with. Transpose keys easily in a single swipe! 

The Key, or exact pitch, is labeled using standard scientific pitch notation: 

 [letter name][pitch octave] 

A4 corresponds to the 440 Hz frequency. C4 is the C directly above A4, A5 is the A exactly one octave higher than A4, and so forth. 

The Interval, or musical relationship between two pitches, is likewise labeled using standard music notation shorthand: 

 [interval quality][interval number] 

For example "m3" means the minor 3rd, while "A5" means the Augmented 5th, and so on. 

Interval quality: 

 P = Perfect 
 M = Major 
 m = minor 
 A = Augmented 
 d = diminished 

The Meter dictates the pattern and division of time. For example, "7:8" means each time measure has the length of 7 8th notes. If you are unfamiliar with meter signatures, it is recommended to simply leave it at the default "2:4" or "4:4" settings. 

The Tempo is set in BPM, also known as "beats-per-minute." The higher the tempo, the faster the beat. 

Tap Tempo is a great way to match the tempo of your favorite songs. Simply tap the "TAP" button to a beat and the metronome quickly locks on to the tempo. The "TAP" button will light red while it is actively listening and acquiring a new tempo. Since there are no mechanical parts, you may find this function to be extremely quick and accurate! 

Metronome mode also provides Visual Feedback to your programmed tempo, flashing red during the downbeat and green during the offbeat. This can be adjusted under the Settings menu to provide feedback only during the downbeat or to be disabled entirely. Note that Visual Feedback is automatically disabled at extremely high tempos!

Mozart's Friend includes a chromatic tuner which tracks notes quickly and accurately, giving a clear view of your tuning from across the room. 

You may find that Mozart's Friend's Tuner can tune from farther away than most tuner devices, and is also more resistant to background noise. The large pitch indicators also facilitate tuning from afar. 

The tuner is completely fiddle-free, as no interaction is needed whatsoever. As soon as you're in Tuner mode, the tuner is ON and actively listening for a primary frequency. 

Note: certain Android devices are known to have difficulty picking up in Tuner mode. Normal operation allows accurate tuning of an acoustic guitar from over six feet away, even against interferring background noise. Electric instruments may require amplification to be picked up. 

To test if the tuner is working properly on your Android device, you can simply hum or whistle at arm length from your device and it should display the frequency and relative distance from the nearest pitch via the large indicators.

Mozart's Friend is the only app with a one-touch backup band! Just select a musical style and you're up and running. Adjust your track on the fly quickly and precisely with the adjustable tempo and key! 

Jam Tracks were designed to give practicing musicians an alternative to the metronome for a lightning quick and fuss-free way to practice. Some tracks contain just percussion, while others may contain more instruments such as bass and keyboards. Sound dock or earbuds recommended for rocking out! 

The Key, or exact pitch, is labeled using standard scientific pitch notation: 

 [letter name][pitch octave] 

A4 corresponds to the 440 Hz frequency. C4 is the C directly above A4, A5 is the A exactly one octave higher than A4, and so forth. 

When you change the Key, ALL instruments on the track automatically transpose to the new pitch! 

The Tempo is set in BPM, also known as "beats-per-minute." The higher the tempo, the faster the beat. 

Along with the tempo slider and increment/decrement buttons, Tap Tempo allows you to input tempo both quickly and easily. Simply tap the "TAP" button and the track quickly locks on to the tempo. The "TAP" button will light red while it is actively listening and acquiring a new tempo. Since there are no mechanical parts, you may find this function to be extremely quick and accurate!
